==Japanese==
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Tatsoi}}
[[File:Tatsoi.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|塌菜}} (''tātsai'', ''tāsai''): a head of '''[[tatsoi]]''' greens.]]
</div>

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=たあつぁい}}
From {{etyl|cmn|ja|sort=たあつぁい}} {{m|zh|塌菜|tr=tācài}}.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ターツァイ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ターツァイ}}

# ''[[Brassica rapa subsp. narinosa]]'' (syns. ''[[Brassica narinosa]]'', ''[[Brasica rapa var. narinosa]]'', ''[[Brassica rapa var. rosularis]]''), an edible [[green]] [[vegetable]] known variously in English as {{l|en|tatsoi}}, [[spinach mustard]], [[spoon mustard]], or [[rosette bok choy]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=たあさい}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''tātsai'' above,<ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> changing the ''tsa'' sound to ''sa'' in conformance with native Japanese phonetics.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ターサイ|acc=1}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ターサイ|タアサイ}}

# ''[[Brassica narinosa]]'' or ''[[Brassica rapa var. rosularis]]'', an edible [[green]] [[vegetable]] known variously in {{etyl|en|-}} as {{m|en|tatsoi}}, [[spinach mustard]], [[spoon mustard]], or [[rosette bok choy]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''tāsai'' reading fits into native Japanese phonetics, and may be more common among some speakers. Some sources <ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> suggest that the ''tātsai'' reading might be considered more correct.
